question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes. Implement a Vue2 offline map component using Cesium (covering only Zhengzhou city).

checklist.title: Is the Cesium map initialization and configuration properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the Cesium map instance is correctly initialized with proper viewport configuration, appropriate default camera position targeting Zhengzhou (coordinates approximately 34.7°N, 113.6°E), and essential Cesium widgets. Score 0 if map initialization fails, 5 if basic initialization exists but with incorrect Zhengzhou positioning, and 10 if initialization includes proper Zhengzhou focus with appropriate altitude and angle settings.

checklist.title: Is offline map data for Zhengzhou city correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code includes proper configuration for offline tile sets, with correct paths to local terrain and imagery assets specific to Zhengzhou boundaries. Check if there's proper tile caching mechanism and local resource management. Deduct 5 points if only partial offline capabilities are implemented, 8 points if offline mode is mentioned but not functionally implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the Vue2 component structure properly designed?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code follows Vue2 best practices with proper component lifecycle methods (especially for Cesium resource management in mounted/beforeDestroy hooks), proper prop validation, emitted events, and a cleanly encapsulated component structure. Check for memory leak prevention with proper destruction of Cesium entities. Deduct 3 points for each missing critical lifecycle management aspect, and 5 points if Vue reactivity is not properly integrated with Cesium. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are essential map navigation controls and user interactions implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the component includes necessary map interactions such as zoom, pan, rotation, and provides a user-friendly UI for these controls specific to the Zhengzhou area. Check for proper event handling of user interactions and appropriate visual feedback. Score 0 if no controls are implemented, 5 if only basic map navigation exists, and 10 if comprehensive controls with Zhengzhou-specific features (like district selection) are included.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing offline tiles, initialization failures, plugin loading errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Offline POI search within Zhengzhou 2. Custom 3D landmarks for Zhengzhou attractions 3. District-based data visualization layers). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant initialization of Cesium resources (e.g., multiple viewer instances) 2. Function modules unrelated to Zhengzhou mapping (e.g., support for other cities without proper abstraction) 3. Heavy features that affect offline performance (e.g., unnecessary high-resolution textures). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating map services/UI components/data handlers), unit test coverage, and build process optimization for offline assets. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or Cesium instances are not properly encapsulated; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if offline resources are not properly managed in the build process. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching for map controls and UI elements 2) Proper layout spacing for control panels and information displays 3) Professional typography for labels and POIs (legible at various zoom levels). Deduct 3 points for each cluttered control group, 5 points for poor contrast between map and UI elements, and 5 points for illegible labels at standard zoom levels. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the map rendering performance optimized for offline use?
checklist.description: Judge whether the implementation addresses performance concerns: 1) Efficient tile loading strategy for offline use 2) Proper level-of-detail management 3) Frame rate above 30fps during navigation. Deduct 5 points for noticeable stuttering during pan/zoom operations, 3 points for excessive memory usage leading to slowdowns, and 5 points for missing optimization techniques specific to Cesium (like entity clustering or fog). The full score is 10 points.
